meanings.definition: Scatter (seed) on the ground for growing.
meanings.sent1: She sowed the seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sowed the wheat in the field.
meanings.sent3: He sowed the seeds with a big smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: Her words sowed the seeds of doubt in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The wind sowed the seeds far and wide across the meadow.

meanings.definition: Plant (seed) by scattering it on or in the earth.
meanings.sent1: They sowed the flower seeds in the flower bed.
meanings.sent2: The gardener sowed the vegetable seeds in neat rows.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel sowed the acorns all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: His actions sowed the seeds of friendship among the group.
meanings.sent5: The birds sowed the seeds as they flew over the forest.

meanings.sent1: The rain sowed the seeds deep into the soil.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight sowed the seeds of hope in their hearts.
meanings.sent3: His kindness sowed the seeds of compassion in others.
meanings.sent4: The music sowed the seeds of joy in their souls.
meanings.sent5: Her encouragement sowed the seeds of confidence in him.
